column_.text_: On the Tip of My Chip
Eye for an Eye, Quake for a Dile
The Woman Who Pines for Death
So Long as We Draw Breath
A Little Help from the Shadows
Spare the Rod, Spoil the Valley
Only You Can Prevent Forest Flyers
Icy Eye on the Holy Prize
A Quest of Fire and Earth
A Quest of Frost and Storm
As Fierce as the Silver Wolf

My days as a big-name treasure hunter are almost behind 
me—I made one too many blunders, you see. Thing is, there's 
something my partner and I were after that continues to elude 
us. Think you could get it for us?

Hey! Do you like crabs? There's a type called 'wee pincers,'
but my dad says they're getting harder to find. If you spot
some, can I have them? I've always wanted pet crabs!

Well, I've run out of whorlshrooms. Though they're not used
very often, there are a few pesky ailments where they act as
a miracle reagent. Could you supply some more?

Blast those goblins. They've always pestered us, sure, but
lately they've become more and more vicious. Teach them a
lesson, will you?

I'd better stock up on whorlshrooms, what with the recent
discovery. Turns out, a little fermentation turns them into
a powerful laxative! It's a revolution for digestive health!

Have any cool rocks? I collect local stones, paint 'em up,
and sell 'em to my adoring fans. I have no idea why people
like 'em, but I always run out. Could you find more for me?

Stupid wyverns, attacking our transport ships... We've
already notified the crew alliance, but there's too many of
the sky rats. Do us a favor and wipe out any you run into.

All I've ever wanted to do is open an airship museum. Could
you help me put together my first exhibit? Bring me
something from an airship that's seen battle—even debris
will do!

I can't remember the last time I asked a handyman for a favor... 
How nostalgic. If you come across one of his flyers, could you 
bring it my way? Now that I think about it, this new guy looks 
just like the one I used to know way back when. How uncanny.

Seen any frosted flowers? I want to extract their essence
for an experimental potion—like the fabled witch's brew that
instantly cured amnesia!

Heard about the snow pillow? It's just a rock, but they say
a pilgrim went to sleep with his head on it and never woke
up. Weird enough, now it's a good luck charm for sleep!

Shh! Keep your voice down! Can't you see I'm on a secret 
mission here? I'm trying to get info on a certain cocktail 
called "Sparkling Innocence"! If you know anything, could 
you let me—and only me—know? I'll make it worth your while.

Ahh, my creative juices are boiling! I just can't get those
ice-covered stalactites out of my head! One would look so
good in my next design! Think you could procure any?

Daggum weather vane went and broke down during a storm. 
Was only a good luck charm, but it don't even spin no more! 
That don't sit right with me. Help me find a replacement?

I need your help obtaining a certain material to complete my
plaster mix. You heard of desert ash? Lots of minerals in
it, but I can't find even a pinch!

Look, Boss needs a report on Avia's forces. Could you go
fight some of the punks and let me know what you think of
their skills?

More and more reports of wolf attacks on caravans and 
researchers keep coming in every day... We need to do 
something about this, and soon... Say, you're skyfarers, 
right? Think you could help us out?

There's no end to all the requests for aid to Ainsteddo... 
But first we'll need to assess just how bad the situation 
in Tempeal is. We could really use skyfarers like you right 
about now. We'd be grateful for any intel you can offer us.

Have any salamander eggs on you? Apparently, no one's ever
tasted them, but they're guaranteed to be delicious!
Heartburn, you say? Like that'll stop a true gourmand!

I'd like a new book. I've heard those infamous Avia folks
have quite the interesting prayer collection! Would you find
me a copy, dear? I don't care about the condition.

One little magma worm—that's all I need to complete my
collection. I'd fetch my trusty net right now, but Phondam's
too dangerous for a humble hobbyist like myself.

I need a training dummy, but I don't have any spare rupies.
I guess I could build one myself, but I'll need a base to
start with. Would you find me something I can work with?

Yo, got a red-hot cactus? I need one for this new drink I've
got planned for the bar—I'm thinking, like, a tequila base
but lit on fire. Sounds sweet, right?

My partner's about to hang up his hat all on account of some 
stupid cobra. Makes my blood boil! Think you could go and 
take out the snake for him? I'll give you a little special something 
I found in the ruins as a reward if you do!

I cannot bear it, to see a lost soul earthbound for
eternity. Should you come across the poor husk, would you
purify him? Simply beat him into oblivion.

Crap... Those Sword Veil crazies have their eye on us again. 
I have no idea why, though—it's not like WE'RE the ones 
giving them a hard time. Say... Think you could go and 
calm them down for us?

They say there's this charm out there that can be crafted from
a mix of essences of dark and ice—but only the kind of ice that 
never melts! From what I hear, we'll be needing tons of the stuff... 
Could I ask you to get some for me?

Those dumb monsters messed up our airship pretty bad—ripped
our propeller clean off. We don't have the cash for a new one,
but we'd appreciate any replacement you could rustle up.

The new recruits need a boost. A fortitude shard should do
the trick—they're forged from the passion of ancient
warriors. If you have any left over, could you share them
with us?

What were they called again? You know, those red stones
harboring untold power? Maaan, why can't I remember their
name! They even use them as fuel for airships! Help me!

Curse that quakadile! It looked like such a comfy rock, but
when I tried to take a seat, it attacked me! I dropped my
bag as I fled, and now I want payback! Get that rock croc!

Wyverns are the worst! If it weren't for their incessant
swarming, my airship would still be in skyfaring shape...
Just thinking about them gets me riled up—I want them gone!

Oh dear... If only I had a flame gyre core, I could stoke my
forge without breaking my back. Would you save these old
bones and track one down for me?

Ever seen Scarmiglione? Its bones are said to be frozen so
solid that no heat can defrost them. If I could get ahold of
one, then our radiators would never overheat again!

I successfully constructed fire shards from a magma worm 
using metamorphic magic, but I've yet to replicate the results. 
If you have any grubs on hand, I'd love to continue the study.

Gardens are homes to all sorts of wildlife, but with these
predatory hornbirds wheeling around, most critters are
keeping well away. Get rid of this invasive species, please!

Avia's warships are state-of-the-art, but it's hard to
express interest openly without coming off as insensitive.
Think you could sneak me a few warship parts?

Hehehe... It's my dream to make a cute mechanical puppet
that feels alive. For the next stage of the build, I require
a machine unit from a Tayu'itar. Don't let me down.

I'm a slime researcher, studying what the little gooballs are
made of, and I find myself in need of new specimens. You
give 'em the boot, and I'll collect the goop.

I successfully constructed light shards from a busted
manikin by using metamorphic magic—not the elemental
attunement I was expecting. Isn't learning fun?

I successfully constructed dark shards from a chromatic
reflection by using metamorphic magic. But what is a
'reflection' in the first place? This sky is full of
mysteries.

I successfully constructed water shards from an ice spire by
using metamorphic magic. Ugh. Ice already melts into
water—this is just plain chemistry!

I successfully constructed earth shards from desert ash by
using metamorphic magic. Another mundane transmutation. No
magical innovations were had today.

I successfully constructed wind shards from cobblestone by
using metamorphic magic—a marvelous transmutation! Perhaps
it's because these pebbles are shaped by wind...

I'm researching spirit ecology. I theorize that earth gyre
compositions differ based on the mineral makeup of their
surroundings. Could you fight one and share your insight?

Are you into flowers? They say frosted flowers symbolize
remembrance. I think it's because they never wither, even in
the ice. Would you be willing to sell some to me?

Out of fortitude crystals, and considering I'm a blacksmith,
that's terrible news. Maybe I shouldn't have made so many
test pauldrons... Anyway, if you find more, could I have 'em?

Could I bother you? They say the power of the primeval gods
resides in flawed prisms. I'd like to have such an
awe-inspiring item in my home shrine.

I need your help. There's a powerful skeleton which needs to
be purged. I would do it myself, but I lack the strength
to purify such a vindictive soul. Will you go in my stead?

Tomorrow is a brand new start! I'm going off on an
adventure, and I'd like a good luck charm for my journey. I
hear tempestones help regulate wind—sounds like a good start
to me!

Tayu'itar armor is amazing. Magic can't blast it; bullets
don't pierce it. If I could get my hands on a sample and see
what it was made of, no doubt I could rig up something
similar.

We had drills planned on Mt. Neigelith, but an aqua gyre in
the area made access to water difficult. Could you deal with
it? We need to drink—and not dirty melted snow.

I have succeeded in reconstructing a fire orb from fire
shards. Collect enough shards, and I'll generate some orbs
for you—while keeping a fair margin for myself, of course.

That ominous form, it was terrifying. I haven't been able to
sleep a wink since seeing it. Would you get rid of it so I
can have some peace of mind?

I have succeeded in reconstructing a light orb from light
shards. Where there is light, there is shadow. And the
stronger the light, the deeper the shadow. Take that as a
warning.

I have succeeded in reconstructing a dark orb from dark
shards. Note that dark magic often consumes the
practitioner. Many mages have peered into the abyss, never
to return.

I have succeeded in reconstructing a water orb from water
shards. Water is the mother of life; to know her is to know
the vital essence of all things. But her mysteries run deep...

I have succeeded in reconstructing an earth orb from earth
shards. Golems born from earth are not considered sentient,
yet they behave like living creatures. Curious, aren't they?

I have succeeded in reconstructing a wind orb from wind
shards. Wind begets storm; storm begets calm. The dynamics
of our world are so beautifully illustrated by the wind...

What an age we live in, eh? With all the scary stuff going
on, I think I should beef up our household with fortitude
crystals. I know they're normally for weapons, but it can't
hurt!

I stocked too much of a certain item, and now I'm suffering
from success. I could use a few more flawless prisms, so how
about I trade my goods for your prisms? Sound fair?

I'm making a new statue! Specifically, a fire dragon
menacing the skies around him. But the piece is seriously
lacking soul. It needs something to lend it authenticity...

My alchemy textbook says I can synthesize fornax stone with
vermillion powder to create flawless prisms, but it's stupid
hard! I tried so many times, I ran out of materials...

We got a big problem. There's a young what-have-ya-dile
that's been causing us grief. Not sure anybody can bust its
face—It's strong as hell.

I see Angra Mainyu, the god of tragedy, who hides from the
world's eyes. Would you like to relive your battle? My
visions manifest for the worthy—though they will seem very
real...

I see Furycane, god of vitality, who rides upon the wind.
Would you like to relive your battle? My visions manifest
for the worthy—though they will seem very real...

I see Managarmr, god of sequestration, who stalks among the
ice. Would you like to relive your battle? My visions
manifest for the worthy—though they will seem very real...

I see Excavallion, god of fortification, who towers above
the land. Would you like to relive your battle? My visions
manifest for the worthy—though they will seem very real...

I see Vulkan Bolla, god of dread, who slinks through molten
rock. Would you like to relive your battle? My visions
manifest for the worthy—though they will seem very real...

I'm making an icy statue! You see, I dreamed of an ice
dragon climbing toward heaven, and I haven't been able to
put the image out of mind since! But I need reference
material!

I'm making a rocky statue! Just picture it: an earth dragon,
menacing and eternal. But it's not enough—it needs balance.
Which means I need authentic materials!

I'm making a windy statue. Or a stormy statue, to be more
precise. I'm picturing a wind dragon, descending from gray
clouds to rend the earth—ah, what if I sculpted a live
model!

Caught a glimpse of a cyaegha? They're these horrifying
eyeball monsters. If you find any in your travels, would you
take them down? It's for everyone's safety.

I was once a skyfarer too! It was a life of equal parts
glory and frustration. When I look into fortitude crystals, I
feel like I'm reliving those days. Could you find me a big
one?

I need flawless prisms to fuel my airship, but Siero's fresh
out. You're skyfarers too, right? Got any spare prisms?

One day, I'll be a great mage—why else am I training so
hard? According to the literature, there's a special spell
that uses a flawless prism. If I could just try it out...

Have any high-grade scrap? What am I going to use it for?
Hehehe... That's a trade secret. Better for both of us if
you don't know. I'll ask somebody else if you're not
interested.

I have heard dreadful news. A monster called Gerasene
summons the unholy dead to roam the land as skeletons.
Mighty skyfarers, would you smite this wretch?

Slimes are scaring my cows! It's gotten so bad, the poor
things won't even leave the barn. If you see any slimes
bobbing around, would you teach them a lesson?

Yo, we got a problem. Those flying eye monsters—cyaegha, or
whatever—are pesterin' merchant vessels. And that's bad for
business. You up for some monster bashing?

I'm making a board game, and I'd like to add a griffin
piece, but it's hard to be detailed without seeing the real
thing up close and personal. Maybe I could settle for a
claw?

I have finally succeeded in synthesizing an inferno orb
using metamorphic magic. Long ago, man acquired intelligence
by manipulating fire. Humanity is beholden to its flicker.

The goblins are organizing, and I know the reason why. It's
because the big one is leading them. Take him down and bring
me back his shield—that should show 'em!

Keep this between you and me, but I was with Avia. That's
behind me now, but there's just one thing: the Tayu'itar I
built is still going ballistic. Could you shut it off for me?

Could I pick your brain? I want to figure out if we could
use a golem to protect the city, but what if it goes
berserk? Could you tell us how to fight one, just in case?

Know the secret to making money? You have to corner the
market before anyone else can. Everything that comes after
is just dumb luck. I'll prove it. Let's make a trade!

Know where the real cash is? Taking over an already-boomin'
market. Just improve on what the first fool did! So, how
about a little investment to help me move up in the world?

The ice-wreathed Scarmiglione, it rears its skull once more.
I fear what may happen if we leave it to its own devices.
Would you please destroy this menace?

I have finally succeeded in synthesizing a shining orb using
metamorphic magic. It radiates blinding light, but this is
precisely what is required to dispel the darkest nights.

How do golems move? Do they operate on magic? What limits
exist on their functionality? I need a specimen to study.
Would you bring me a piece of one, even if it's a finger?

I have succeeded in synthesizing an abysm orb using
metamorphic magic. It begs the question: is darkness akin to
nothingness? Is it absence; is it a void? I must think on
this...

I have succeeded in synthesizing a frost orb using
metamorphic magic. One wonders: is it possible to freeze
light? But perhaps such a phenomenon would destroy time and
space...

I have succeeded in synthesizing a rumbling orb using
metamorphic magic. Life takes root in soil, circulating to
and from the earth. Truly, earth is the sole companion of
life.

I have succeeded in synthesizing a cyclone orb using
metamorphic magic. Thanks to you, I've unmasked many secrets
of my craft. What my next project shall be, only the winds
know...

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if
only I could help out more wee pincers hiding in the sky. If you
find any more, would you please bring them back to me?

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if
only I could help out more wee pincers hiding in the sky. If you
find any more, would you please bring them back to me?

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if
only I could help out more wee pincers hiding in the sky. If you
find any more, would you please bring them back to me?

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if
only I could help out more wee pincers hiding in the sky. If you
find any more, would you please bring them back to me?

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if
only I could help out more wee pincers hiding in the sky. If you
find any more, would you please bring them back to me?

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if

find any more, would you please bring them back to me?

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if
only I could help out more wee pincers hiding in the sky. If you
find any more, would you please bring them back to me?

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if
only I could help out more wee pincers hiding in the sky. If you
find any more, would you please bring them back to me?

The wee pincer seems to be taking nicely to its new home. Now if
only I could help out more wee pincers hiding in the sky. If you
find any more, would you please bring them back to me?

Thanks for rounding up so many of the little guys. Dad finally
gave me a tally, and I think it's gonna be hard coming across
any more, but... keep your eyes peeled!

Oh, I simply MUST carry out more research on these slimes... 
But I'm in dire need of more specimens. Would you go after 
the one that calls itself king for me? Hard to miss, just look 
for a huge slime with a crown on its head!

Not... enough... slimes! I need MORE. I won't ask for much
—any ordinary specimen will do! Well, I'll need multiple of 
them, of course. I've got a splendid reward waiting for you, 
so get on it!

A horde of goblins has been spotted in the forest. If nothing is done,
our people won't be able to gather firewood or medicinal herbs, and
trade with other islands will grind to a halt! We urgently need battle-
hardened skyfarers to put a stop to this threat.

Timber wolves have been seen near the village—perhaps due to the
uptick of goblin activity in the area? At best, they'll get into our
livestock; at worst, they might harm our children. Please, we need
someone to rid the forest of this menace!

My papa's a lumbarjak. But I know there's a big monster leeving in
the forust. I'm worreed about papa. Can sumbody beat the monster
pleaze?

Now that the primeval god has been subdued, we've spotted a nascent
Hallowed Ground. Unfortunately, its powers have yet to mature, and some
local goblins have come to destroy the site! We need a crew to rebuff them—
just until the sacred crystal begins to glow with monster-repelling light!

Goblins have launched another attack on Tempeal. Although the locals have
suffered no casualties, these beastmen have overtaken the old fort and now
threaten nearby residents. We're looking to launch a siege, but we could
use your help. Think you could get in there and create a diversion for us?

Hoo boy... Those damned goblins who attacked our village—huff (sic)—are 
back again! They obey their alpha—wheeze (sic)—so if we take him out... 
Guess that's easier said than done... Man, I ran all the way from home to 
post this—why are you recording how I'm breathing?!

There are current reports of monsters traversing the skyways southbound 
from Folca, which presents a problem for our regular air service. We're
looking for skyfarers willing to seek out and dispatch these beasts.
Preference given to crews in possession of anti-air weaponry.

I heard a nasty rumor that those Avia brutes are walking around
Tempeal like they own the place—and we've just barely evacuated to
Folca! The nerve! I also heard they're planning to make a new base in
Tempeal, which is totally unacceptable! Please, protect our home!

Hordes of monsters assault our sacred valley. Lady Historiath would take care
of them herself, but she is still recovering after the incident with the primeval
god. We've done our best combatting this evil, but I fear we will soon reach
our limit. We call upon noble and brave warriors to bolster our ranks!

Ever since the day our eyes met, I can't stop thinking about him.
It's like he saw directly into my soul with that big, bright pupil, and
now I see him every night in my dreams. I haven't slept a wink in
weeks. Please, for my sake... destroy him.

Apparently monsters have been spotted in the forest outside Folca. I could 
try to handle it myself, but if these end up being big monsters, I'd likely be 
in trouble. Someone with a proven track record might be of more use here.
Someone like yourself, perhaps? How about it?

Now that Zegagrande's era of peace has passed, the people long for new 
tales of heroism. To answer the will of the masses, I must see firsthand the 
skyfarers who felled the primeval god of vitality! Let mine eyes feast upon thy 
glorious figures in combat, brave warriors, so all may know your true might!

Sup? It's Dagger. Recently came across a pretty sweet find on Dahli Island, 
but Rilla—the dumbass—got too noisy with the TNT and attracted a whole 
bunch of monsters. I hate cleaning up after him, but if I don't do something,
Boss is gonna clean my hide. Think you could do me a solid?

Hey, it's me. This is going to sound like BS, but hear me out. I ordered my boys
to fetch me some treasure, see? But Dagger—the dumbass—was hitting the 
sauce while on duty, and dropped it. Monsters caught his scent, and now he's 
on the run. Can you go clean up his mess? Why do I even pay these jokers?

Rumor has it a golem's been discovered on Dahli. These things are exceedingly 
rare, so we have next to no literature detailing their physiology and mannerisms. 
This could be my big chance... but will admin even give me the budget to pursue 
this? You know what? Who cares—bring me back a piece of that golem, please!

Hey, it's me. Our favorite bunch of star-loons has caused a mess in the volcano.
Nothing major's gone down yet, but I want the area investigated just in case. 
I was going to send Soupstock, but he's not used to the rough stuff. Anyway, 
we'll pay you. Just take care of any Avia jerks you run across, capisce?

Remnants of Lilith's crusaders will soon attack Seedhollow Castle. We still
have wounded and homeless taking refuge within its walls, but our forces
are stretched thin. We need reinforcements and we need them now.

Yes, I see it clearly... Blood has been spilled. In the undercroft of Seedhollow 
Castle, warriors of darkness begin to stir. If you act now, you may be able 
to thwart them. But hesitate for even a moment, and our forces will crumble.
Even I dare not peek into that future...

Your fight with the primeval god of vitality was truly the stuff of legends! But now 
it's time to pen the second chapter, and I think I've found the perfect stage—
Mt. Neigelith! Please, fell the icy wolf sequestered there, that I might get a book
dea—ahem, immortalize your epic deeds for the sake of our precious progeny!

Your exploits are gaining renown! Before long, we'll be selling thousands 
of—your tale shall enter the annals of legend! Now let us embark upon chapter 
three—onward, to a land of hellish suffering. Fell the primeval god of dread, 
and prove that true heroes don't fear little things like "being burned alive!"

Hornbirds and wyverns are known to wreak havoc on good airships, and
with recent sightings of these pests increasing along our trade routes,
new maintenance requests have been flooding in. We'd like an
experienced crew to clean up our skyways ASAP.

A group of monsters has appeared in the forest, and it's possible
they'll set their sights on Folca next. Our force is already stretched thin,
so please, brave skyfarers, come to our aid.

Had another goblin attack in the village the other day, and they raided
all the bars in town—except for one! Mine! My barley juice is just as
good as anybody else's! I'll never forgive those goblins or their horrible
taste buds! Go teach 'em a lesson they'll never forget!

Sob... Hey peeps, it's me. I keep steppin' in it, and now all the boys are
mad at me. But I was thinkin', if I beat down a quakadile, maybe they
would put respect on my name again. So would you awesome dudes go
bag a rocky croc for me? That's just as good as doing it myself, right?

Bro, you won't believe what I saw! A goblin warrior—in Skywyrm Valley!
And he had the biggest delts I've ever seen! Man, I am jonesing for
another look! I've got eagle eyes, so I won't get close, but would you
pick a fight with him so I can get my muscle fix? Thanks, bro!

I heard a sandstorm on Dahli Island kicked up some historic artifacts,
coins included. Unfortunately, the bane of coin enthusiasts everywhere,
silver slimes, love a metallic scent, and they've also been sighted in the
area. Get to those pennies before the slimes digest 'em all!

Yes, I see it clearly... A Hallowed Ground, deep in the heart of the fiery 
mountain, cries for relief. And where flames burn, fiends gather. Protect this 
holiest of places from destruction. But hesitate for even a moment, and the 
world will lose yet another sacred site. Even I dare not peek into that future...

I'll cut to the chase: I tend to run hot—hard to avoid, being a cook and all. I 
did some research and heard tell of a monster with an icy hide who lives in
Mt. Neigelith. Maybe clothes made from that leather would help me stay cool
in the kitchen? Bring me back a hide, please! My pores are begging you!

Though griffin meat isn't normally eaten around these parts, their mantle
muscles must develop an interesting texture from keeping such big bodies
airborne. Would you please defeat a griffin and procure some meat for me? 
A brand new texture just might be a revolution for the culinary world!

There's a big ol' eyeball monster flapping around the Pillar of Vayoi, keeping 
skyfarer crews from surveying the place. We were hired to take it down, but, 
embarrassingly enough, we couldn't cut the mustard. We're looking for a crew 
to handle the rough stuff and let us take the glory—you'll keep the pay, of course.

We've got reports that something massive has been spotted along the way
to Tempeal. Suffice it to say, this warrants investigation. We initially asked 
Rolan to look into it, but we're currently recruiting capable skyfarers to aid 
as well.

Seedhollow forces continue to monitor the Pillar of Vayoi, and recent reports
suggest an influx of dark spirits and monsters. Although they don't seem
to be exiting the tower, we should take precautionary measures and conduct
a sweep of the area. We're looking for skyfarers to handle such an operation.

Urgent request! A large horde of malicious spirits have appeared in 
Seedhollow Castle. We've dispatched our full forces to deal with them, but
we still find ourselves short. If we don't clean this up by the time the nobles
return, there'll be trouble... Please, help us!

I have dispatched many fiends in my day, but some foul creatures do not die
simple deaths; and now one such devil creeps again across Mt. Neigelith's 
sacred paths. Regrettably, our primeval god has not fully recovered, and thus
I am dutybound to its side. I beseech you: destroy the fiend in my stead.

My deepest apologies for this most sudden request, but we've spotted some
suspicious activity on our most sacred mountain—those Avia curs, no doubt.
We would gladly handle this ourselves, but alas, our leader is otherwise
preoccupied. Could we beg your aid, brave skyfarers?

Can you believe it?! An active golem was discovered in a caldera on Phondam!
In all my years of researching these majestic, sentient rocks, I've never heard
of one capable of operating in such a harsh environment! We absolutely need to
bring this speciman in for study—golemology depends on it!

Okay, like, if Seedhollow's supposed to be this bastion of culture or whatever,
why is no one vibing with the local couture anymore? I need a textile that's 
gonna make these Hollowites live, laugh, and love again. Something to really 
get them hot. Fetch me some flame hide, and be quick about it, sweetie.

Yo, Captain. It's your boy, Soupstock. How do I break this to ya? Boss says
he got word a bunch of leftover Lilith-lovers are gonna launch an attack on
the castle. The army says they've got defense covered, but they're all nerds,
so... You'll help us out, right? Be a shame if we lost our city's crown jewel.

Yes, I see them clearly... Dark souls within the valley; wails penetrating
walls... Go now, and defend Mother Nature from this encroachment of
the undead. But hesitate for even a moment, and the ravine will be
consumed by darkness. Even I dare not peek into that future...

The Crew Alliance Rafale has taken note of your crew's skillful accomplishments, 
but we would like to have our own analysts confirm just how you defeated Avia 
and quelled Furycane. If the results are satisfactory, we'll feel comfortable 
entrusting you with even more dangerous responsibilities.

Listen up, soldier! Remember Avia's mega ship? Though we trounced Lilith,
reports say some of her slipperier followers took the ship and fled. We plan
on delivering a direct strike, but we need time to organize. You're going to
raid their vessel and stall until we're ready to strike. That's an order.

I'm with the newly established Phondam Border Authority. We've spotted 
a goblin presence near the volcano, and—believe it or not—they're 
harvesting raw material for explosives! Knowing how cunning the 
little gremlins can be, we'd better douse the issue before it blows up!

We're planning to launch a full-scale investigation of the Pillar of Vayoi, and
for that we'll need to establish a base camp. However, most of our units are
on city reconstruction duty. We could use the hands of seasoned skyfarers like
you. What do you say?

I was in a bar the other night, and this bard was reciting quite the captivating
saga. It was like the heroes were fighting right in front of me... And that got 
me thinking, what if the heroes actually WERE fighting in front of me? I would
love to paint one of your exploits! What do you say?

Our unit is currently investigating Avia's three generals. As you're aware, 
Gallanza played a key role in Avia's assault on Seedhollow Castle, but in the 
battle's final moments, he turned against Lilith. In order to ascertain his true 
loyalties, we'd like you to reconstruct your most telling encounter with him.

Our unit is conducting an investigation on Avia's three generals. As you're
aware, Maglielle led her own sub-faction of Avia called the Sword Veil
Fellowship. To further our understanding of her cabal's values, we'd like you
to reconstruct your most telling encounter with them.

Our forces are currently undergoing extra training to prevent another group 
like Avia from taking hold of our skydom. According to what we know, these 
fanatics were able to revive the giant primeval god residing on Dahli Island. 
Would you be willing to share any information you have on this incident?

The painting I made of your crew facing Managarmr has become one of my
most beloved. It makes sense—before Avia, this skydom was a peaceful 
place, unaccustomed to such displays of violence and passion! Please, let me
illustrate another rousing masterpiece! But this one should be hotter!

We have another dragon sighting on our hands. These creatures are said 
to possess great intelligence and vitality—it wouldn't do to send your
run-of-the-mill skyfarer against them. Could we ask you to take on this
mission in Rolan's stead?

We have another dragon sighting on our hands. Reports say this beast 
is slumbering away in an ancient ruin. These creatures are known to 
seek out powerful individuals and put them to the test. It won't be an 
easy task, but could we ask you to take on this mission in Rolan's stead?

We have another dragon sighting on our hands. Legends around the
Ainsteddo Archipelago tell of a beast that lives somewhere within a
deep valley... We intend to investigate the truth of these tales. Would you
be able to take on this mission in Rolan's stead?

We have another dragon sighting on our hands. Our contacts in Mellose
Monastery inform us that the unsettling roars of a dragon have been heard
on Mt. Neigelith. Perilous though it may be, we must act swiftly. Could we
ask you to take on this mission in Rolan's stead?

Our unit is currently investigating Avia's three generals. As you're aware, Id was 
Lilith's guardian and top commander, but in the battle's final moments he turned 
against his mother and joined your crew. To determine whether he's worthy of
trust, we'd like you to reconstruct your most telling encounter with him.

Thanks to your generous cooperation, citywide investigations into Avia are 
due to wrap up. However, there's still one mystery that eludes us... What 
do you know about the Pillar of Vayoi? Care to share?

Our troops have spotted a mysterious shade in the Pillar of Vayoi. We 
request any crews with sufficient firepower to head to the site and deal
with the threat. This is an extremely urgent matter.

It seems a new Hallowed Ground is in the process of forming upon Mt. 
Neigelith. Alas, it lacks the strength to repel evil spirits. What's worse, 
all manner of vile creatures are drawn to its precious light... It must be
protected at all costs. Skyfarers, could you lend us your aid?

Slimes have infested Seedhollow Castle, and at this rate, they might just
devour the entire complex before we can launch a counterattack. We want
you to destroy as many of the goops as you can. Feel free to keep anything
they drop—we don't have time to clean slime guts off our trophies anyway.

Unbelievable! Another golem sighting! This time, our specimen was seen guarding 
a large patch of windcrest! This behavior warrants investigation, but we can't tell 
if it's active or dormant—at least not without breaking a few bones... Mind 
ensuring that the golem is in hibernation mode before we conduct our study?

Our alliance has received reports of a vicious griffin nearing Tempeal. It
appears to be a new subspecies, many times fiercer and stronger than
specimens we have hitherto observed. Rafale urgently requests that all
available crews take to the skies to contain this looming threat.

It seems the goblins have a new warrior leading them, as attacks on trade 
routes surrounding the old fort are on the rise. If we can take out this leader, 
the rest of the ne'er-do-wells should scramble like roaches! Won't you help
us again, skyfarers? The future of commerce rests upon your shoulders!

A truly fearsome fiend shows itself on the path to Tredame Sanctum. Such is its
strength that our myriad wards can only delay it. If the fiend is allowed to
reach the primeval god's altar, Managarmr will likely rampage once more. This
cannot come to pass. Please, assist us.

Hey, it's me. So I was out, minding my own business, finding new 
treasures—yada, yada—when I spotted an angry quakadile right in my way. 
Can't survey the area with a monster like that stomping around, now can I? 
Take care of it, and I'll make it worth your while. We got a deal?

We've received intel that remnants of the Church of Avia have built and hidden 
an upgraded Tayu'itar model on Phondam. If this weapon were to be destroyed, 
it would severely dampen their morale. This could be the key to ousting these 
zealots once and for all. We need your crew on this mission as soon as possible!

Yes, I see it once more... Blood flows anew, summoning warriors of darkness
to Seedhollow's underbelly. Venture into the depths of our palace, for you
are the only ones who can save this land. But hesitate for even a moment
and, and... Stars above! My vision, it's gone!

Folks are saying a large band of goblins is headed to Folca. Feels like maybe
they want revenge for all the crews we've been sending to deal with 'em... But
we have to defend our home, right? On behalf of Folca's town council, please
save our bacon!

Do you recall when you helped recover our merchandise in Skywyrm Valley? 
It seems the griffin you defeated was the alpha, and now all sorts of airborne 
terrors are vying for its position! Apologies for the trouble, but I fear we must 
course correct and subdue this chaos, lest the local ecology be forever damaged!

I thank you for your efforts in repelling the deadly fiend from before. Now that
it lies defeated, we can finally strike at the source of evil within Mt. Neigelith. 
Should we stem the flow of monsters, I believe peace will reign atop these holy 
peaks. At last, our chance to vanquish darkness from the mount is at hand.

Hey, it's me. Good work with the quakadile. Got myself a lot of glittering 
goodies thanks to you. But there's still one area I'd rather not tread—the 
one with two golems watching over it. Think you can handle 'em? This'll
be a toughie, but I promise you a pretty penny if you help me out.

Remnants of Avia's forces have deployed more of their war machines. 
We'd like to ask you to carry out some formal reconnaissance to find out
what they're truly capable of. If you should defeat them in the process, so 
be it, but prioritize your own safe return above all else!

Yes, I see it clearly... Fire, ice, and stone coalesce upon the Pillar of Vayoi, 
each taking the form of a monster more sinister than the last. There is still 
time to tackle this threat, but hesitate for even a moment, and the very laws 
of nature may be threatened. Even I dare not peek into that future.

Thy most beloved bard is back! News came to me of how you defeated all 
three of Avia's generals—even besting the mighty spear of Gallanza himself! 
How about you weave that memorable battle into the annals of history! Go forth, 
face the Silver Wolf, and make me ric—I mean proud! Make me proud!

A little bird informs me you fought Avia's own Maglielle? And you lived to 
tell the tale? Now that's amazing! Imagine, a crew dancing between 
a thousand whirling blades of death! What visual splendor! Would you 
please face her again? Such a scene deserves proper depiction!

Paintings of your exploits have become the talk of the town. While I'm not 
offended—mrrr, should've signed an exclusivity contract—we simply must put 
the spoken word in the limelight once more! How about another tale? A fight with 
the primeval god of vitality—surely that will capture the hearts and minds of all!

Did I tell you where I got the idea to paint your adventures? It was when I heard 
the saga of your exploits at the bar! But, wow, the bard who told it has gotten 
even better since I first saw him! But I'm not one to be outdone—so please, spare
me one more adventure! Show me your battle with Managarmr.

That blasted artist! After I crafted my greatest work, she had the nerve to create 
an equally expressive painting! I'll have you know that pictures are NOT worth a 
thousand words—WORDS are worth ten thousand pictures! And I'll prove it! Climb
that giant and help me best my archrival! You can even keep the publishing rights!

That bard... He really outdid himself with the tale of the giant god! Now I feel the 
need to paint something equally epic... Oh, but the same subject matter won't
do... I know! A fiery fight in the middle of a volcano—imagine the vibrancy, the
motion! How perfect! Well, what are you waiting for? Go fight that god!

Heroes, you won't believe this! We finally settled our differences and found love
in the process! We were brainstorming ways to celebrate our matrimony, and bam!
It hit us! Why not conclude the epic that brought us together? How about it? A 
grand finale to your saga, and the start of a new adventure for the missus and I!

So I'm thinking about crafting some heat-resistant armor using frostbeast
plates. It's gonna be the best ice-infused armor anyone's ever seen—I can't
wait to see the look on a certain someone's face when it's done! Er, sorry. If
you could get me the materials, there's a reward in it for you. Thanks.

If only I had flamebeast horns, I could make the strongest ice-resistant
shield ever! When you-know-who gets a look at it, he'll just about die of
jealousy! Anyway, if you could handle the whole monster-slaying part,
I'll throw in something nice for you.

All the blacksmiths are abuzz about some new equipment they're trying to 
make. Problem is, to mass-produce the stuff, you need a LOT of adhesives. 
I figure some bone glue could help solve their issue—though we'd need only
the highest quality bones. This is where you come in.

You know, if Id had been victorious that day, we'd probably still be captives 
of Avia. Just thinkin' about it keeps me up at night... Would you mind helping
me put those thoughts to rest? Relive your fight with Id one more time!

Thanks to all the intel you've provided, we've successfully established a new 
unit capable of countering all sorts of threats. We are grateful for all that
you've done, but I do have one final request: tell us—what happened on that 
fateful day when Avia was dissolved? What happened during the final battle?

A request from a mysterious figure came in, specifically asking for your crew.
I've copied a transcript below. Our staff couldn't make heads or tails of it, but
perhaps you'll know what to do? Best of luck! 
"Yghtym rserafysk! Evopr selvesruoy nythyw eth rtaeh fo eryf!"

A request from a mysterious figure came in, specifically asking for your crew. 
I've copied a transcript below. Our staff couldn't make heads or tails of it, but
perhaps you'll know what to do? Best of luck!
"Y tyawa eth dylos fo rtaeh dna dnym dyma eth ndsas."

A request from a mysterious figure came in, specifically asking for your crew. 
I've copied a transcript below. Our staff couldn't make heads or tails of it, but
perhaps you'll know what to do? Best of luck!
"Ylno eth ftysw yam rente ym ralta fo ndyw! Myacl ruoy ecapl!"

A request from a mysterious figure came in, specifically asking for your crew. 
I've copied a transcript below. Our staff couldn't make heads or tails of it, but
perhaps you'll know what to do? Best of luck!
"Chus dygyfr sllyw... Nyoj em pota eth nyantuom fo ecy."

Was Mt. Neigelith always such a death trap, or did I just get unlucky? I got 
chased out by some huge one-eyed monster into an area just dripping with
dark energies... I got out of there—just barely. Could you clean the place up
and make sure that doesn't happen to any other poor sap?

Ugh. Quakadile's blocking a vital desert trade route, which isn't just pissing
off people, but it's even got local rock golems all stirred up. What a mess.
If things stay as is, our archeological research of Dahli will slow to a crawl!
Please do something fast!

It's been suggested that Phondam's recent surge in volcanic activity stems
from infernadiles invading the lair of a resident dragon. Now, just because
people don't live on the island doesn't mean Frightflame Altar ought to fall
into ruin. I'm sure brave skyfarers can settle this matter.

My crew and I were culling monsters on Mt. Neigelith when we fell down a
crevasse. Unfortunately a monster's nest broke our fall. What I saw after that
was pure hell. Now I'm all alone, unfit to pick up the sword again. You gotta
get revenge for me... and my fallen crew.

Good news is we've managed to reduce the number of monsters outside of 
Folca. Bad news is, we just corralled them all into one area, creating a 
powder keg about to go off. We need to move fast to take them all out 
before they strike back. Are you up to the task?

A gang of bandits stole jewels from a dragon duo, meaning the enraged beasts
are going to raze the island to get their treasures back. While our teams go
hunt for the idiot thieves and the goods they stole, we need you to hold back
the dragons.

It seems that the reason the remnants of Avia went to Mt. Neigelith was to
enlist the help of dragons living there, but they merely enraged two of them
instead. You'd need an army to take down a single one, but since there's two...
Uh, good luck!

You'll do whatever these requests tell you to, right? Good! Then come face me
and the boss of the Sword Veil again! It's time we had ourselves another
fun-filled deathmatch!

Id's given us some more information on Furycane Nihilla. It seems to be a 
personified form of the lingering calamity of a primal beast that took root 
here long ago—which is to say, it should not exist. With Angra Mainyu 
pacified, things should be safe, but... could you look into this just in case?

Could you tell me more about your fight with Managarm Nihilla? They say 
it was just as fearsome as when you fought General Gallanza! I'm writing 
a book about his feats, you see, so this would be an enormous help. Could 
you recount the battle for me?

I wish to hear of your battle with Vulkan Bolla Nihilla. Our lady has ordered 
us to reflect on it, that we may learn from your bravery. Though these 
memories may be painful, I humbly beg you to share them with us, that 
we may glean wisdom from them!

A request from an individual calling themselves the "dragon's apostle" came in, 
specifically asking for your crew. I've copied a transcript below. Our staff couldn't
make heads or tails of it, but perhaps you'll know what to do? Best of luck!
 "Rednuth sesrouc ny ruoy snyev; ruo elttab llyw etanymully eth seysk!"

A request from an individual calling themselves the "dragon's apostle" came in, 
specifically asking for your crew. I've copied a transcript below. Our staff couldn't
make heads or tails of it, but perhaps you'll know what to do? Best of luck!
 "Reep otny eth ssyba, ghouth eraweb tawh sezag ckab"

When we first met, you mentioned you witnessed Bahamut go on a rampage, 
no? I was thinking of turning that into a story for the kids. Could you describe 
the events to me? Don't worry, I'll make sure to give the whole tale an 
appropriately dramatic flourish!

A massive mechanized contraption has appeared near the island of Dahli... 
The advance party of skyfarers we sent out were sadly wiped out—that
leaves us in quite a tight spot. Could we ask your aid? It will require careful
preparation, but I believe you are up to the task.
Speak with Rackam, Io, and Rosetta
Knock some sense into Proto Bahamut
Find a way out of the forest
